page.title: 10NORMA'S CATTERY,MORETON
page.content: Norma's Cattery is a boarding cattery where people leave their cats when they go on holiday,move house,go into hospital or go abroad on a business trip and like to know that their cat can be looked after well.The cattery holds up to forty cats.Norma does all the work herself,which involves cleaning out the pens and feeding them twice a day.The average stay for cats is two-three weeks,but sometimes its a year.Before they arrive the cats have to be innoculated against cat flu and enteritis.Tom cats have to be neutered before arriving.Each cat has its own individual pen.The food is delivered in bulk but some owners bring their own food.Norma breeds Persian cats from her own stock of 14.Norma also keeps dogs,chickens,ducks,geese,sheep, goats and a horse, as pets.
